holding.name: Inverter Enabled
holding.description: Bitfield controlling remote enable of the inverter (bit 0) and the battery DC converter or BDC ready mode (bit 1). Write the combined value 0-3; 1 turns on the inverter, 2 turns on only the BDC, 3 turns on both.
holding.note: Home Assistant preserves other control bits when toggling this value.

holding.name: Safety function enable flags
holding.description: Bit mask that enables regional grid-protection functions. Set a bit to 1 to enable the corresponding feature (SPI, LVFRT, DRMS, Volt-Var, ROCOF, recovery, split-phase).
holding.note: Bits 0-3 cover CEI 0-21 compliance; bits 4-6 cover AS/NZS/SAA requirements; bits 11-15 are reserved.

holding.name: Persist power-factor commands
holding.description: Choose whether the power-factor and derating commands in registers 3, 4, 5, and 99 are stored to NVRAM (1) or revert to defaults after the next restart (0).

holding.name: Active power limit setpoint
holding.description: Maximum active power output as a percentage of rated power. Values 0-100 cap the output; 255 removes the limit.

holding.name: Reactive power limit setpoint
holding.description: Maximum reactive power magnitude as a percent of rated capacity. Negative values request capacitive (leading) support, positive values inductive (lagging). 255 removes the limit.

holding.name: Power factor target
holding.description: Requested power factor multiplied by 10,000 (e.g. 9900 equals 0.99). Values below 10,000 lead (capacitive); values above 10,000 lag (inductive).

holding.name: Rated apparent power
holding.description: Apparent power capability encoded as an unsigned 32-bit value with 0.1 VA resolution (register 6 is the high word, register 7 the low word).

holding.name: Nominal PV voltage
holding.description: Target PV input voltage for maximum power point tracking, stored in 0.1 V increments.

holding.name: Firmware
holding.description: Six registers containing ASCII characters that describe the running firmware. Registers 9-11 hold the DSP identifier; registers 12-14 hold the control-board identifier. Home Assistant reads the combined 12-character string for the reported firmware version.

holding.name: LCD language selection
holding.description: Language index used by the local LCD interface: 0=Italian, 1=English, 2=German, 3=Spanish, 4=French, 5=Chinese, 6=Polish, 7=Portuguese, 8=Hungarian.

holding.name: Country profile configured
holding.description: Indicates whether a regional grid profile has been selected (1) or still needs to be chosen (0).

holding.name: PV start voltage threshold
holding.description: Minimum DC input voltage required before the inverter starts, stored in 0.1 V increments.

holding.name: Start-up delay
holding.description: Delay between meeting the PV start voltage and enabling the inverter output, measured in seconds.

holding.name: Restart delay
holding.description: Time to wait after a fault clears before restarting the inverter, in seconds.

holding.name: Active power ramp rate (startup)
holding.description: Slope for increasing active power after startup in 0.1% increments per second (1-1000).

holding.name: Active power ramp rate (restart)
holding.description: Slope for returning to full power after curtailment or a cleared fault, expressed in 0.1% per second.

holding.name: Modbus RTU baud rate
holding.description: Selects the RS-485 serial line baud rate: 0=9600 bps, 1=38400 bps.

holding.name: Serial Number
holding.description: ASCII-encoded 10-character serial number spanning registers 23-27.
holding.note: The Home Assistant integration exposes this as the device serial number and reuses it as the unique identifier.

holding.name: Inverter Model
holding.description: 32-bit hardware option mask encoded as eight nibbles (A, B, D, T, P, U, M, S). Register 28 holds the high word and register 29 the low word.
holding.note: Home Assistant renders this value as the string A# B# D# T# P# U# M# S# via the integration's model() helper.

holding.name: Modbus slave address
holding.description: RS-485/Modbus RTU slave ID. Set a value between 1 and 254; 0 is reserved for broadcast frames.

holding.name: Firmware update trigger
holding.description: Write 1 to arm the serial firmware update procedure. The inverter clears the flag after the bootloader handshake starts.

holding.name: Reset user configuration
holding.description: Writing 1 clears user-configurable settings such as communication parameters and regional profiles.
holding.note: Use with caution; the inverter immediately reboots and loses provisioning data.

holding.name: Factory reset
holding.description: Writing 1 restores full factory defaults and restarts the inverter.
holding.note: Equivalent to the front-panel factory reset. Requires re-commissioning afterwards.

holding.name: Manufacturer information string
holding.description: Sixteen ASCII characters written at production time (batch, plant, or custom identifiers).
holding.note: The original table lists these words as Manufacturer Info 8â€“1 (high/middle/low); combine them to read the full string.

holding.name: G100 failsafe enable
holding.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the UK G98/G100 failsafe watchdog.
holding.note: Leave off unless the interconnection agreement requires the G100 failsafe mode.

holding.name: Device Type Code
holding.description: Encodes the inverter family and tracker count. See data type for supported values.

holding.name: Number Of Trackers And Phases
holding.description: High byte holds the number of PV trackers; low byte holds the number of output phases.

holding.name: System clock year
holding.description: Calendar year stored by the internal real-time clock.
holding.note: Write the full year (for example 2024).

holding.name: System clock month
holding.description: Calendar month for the internal clock.

holding.name: System clock day
holding.description: Day of month for the internal clock.

holding.name: System clock hour
holding.description: Hour of day in 24-hour format.

holding.name: System clock minute
holding.description: Minute component of the internal clock.

holding.name: System clock second
holding.description: Second component of the internal clock.

holding.name: System clock weekday
holding.description: Day-of-week index for the internal clock (0=Sunday, 6=Saturday).

holding.name: Stage 1 undervoltage limit
holding.description: Grid voltage threshold for stage 1 undervoltage protection, stored in 0.1 V increments. Delay configured by register 68.

holding.name: Stage 1 overvoltage limit
holding.description: Grid voltage threshold for stage 1 overvoltage protection (0.1 V increments). Delay configured by register 69.

holding.name: Stage 1 underfrequency limit
holding.description: Grid frequency threshold for stage 1 underfrequency protection (0.01 Hz increments). Delay configured by register 72.

holding.name: Stage 1 overfrequency limit
holding.description: Grid frequency threshold for stage 1 overfrequency protection (0.01 Hz increments). Delay configured by register 73.

holding.name: Stage 2 undervoltage limit
holding.description: Grid voltage threshold for stage 2 undervoltage protection, stored in 0.1 V increments. Delay configured by register 70.

holding.name: Stage 2 overvoltage limit
holding.description: Grid voltage threshold for stage 2 overvoltage protection (0.1 V increments). Delay configured by register 71.

holding.name: Stage 2 underfrequency limit
holding.description: Grid frequency threshold for stage 2 underfrequency protection (0.01 Hz increments). Delay configured by register 74.

holding.name: Stage 2 overfrequency limit
holding.description: Grid frequency threshold for stage 2 overfrequency protection (0.01 Hz increments). Delay configured by register 75.

holding.name: Stage 3 undervoltage limit
holding.description: Grid voltage threshold for stage 3 undervoltage protection, stored in 0.1 V increments. Delay configured by register 76.

holding.name: Stage 3 overvoltage limit
holding.description: Grid voltage threshold for stage 3 overvoltage protection (0.1 V increments). Delay configured by register 77.

holding.name: Stage 3 underfrequency limit
holding.description: Grid frequency threshold for stage 3 underfrequency protection (0.01 Hz increments). Delay configured by register 78.

holding.name: Stage 3 overfrequency limit
holding.description: Grid frequency threshold for stage 3 overfrequency protection (0.01 Hz increments). Delay configured by register 79.

holding.name: Reconnect undervoltage limit
holding.description: Minimum grid voltage (0.1 V increments) required before reconnecting after a trip.

holding.name: Reconnect overvoltage limit
holding.description: Maximum grid voltage (0.1 V increments) allowed when reconnecting after a trip.

holding.name: Reconnect underfrequency limit
holding.description: Minimum grid frequency (0.01 Hz increments) required for reconnection.

holding.name: Reconnect overfrequency limit
holding.description: Maximum grid frequency (0.01 Hz increments) allowed when reconnecting.

holding.name: Stage 1 undervoltage trip delay
holding.description: Number of cycles grid voltage must stay below the stage 1 undervoltage limit (register 52) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 1 overvoltage trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid voltage must stay above the stage 1 overvoltage limit (register 53) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 2 undervoltage trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid voltage must stay below the stage 2 undervoltage limit (register 56) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 2 overvoltage trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid voltage must stay above the stage 2 overvoltage limit (register 57) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 1 underfrequency trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid frequency must stay below the stage 1 underfrequency limit (register 54) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Modbus Version
holding.description: Cycles grid frequency must stay above the stage 1 overfrequency limit (register 55) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 2 underfrequency trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid frequency must stay below the stage 2 underfrequency limit (register 58) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 2 overfrequency trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid frequency must stay above the stage 2 overfrequency limit (register 59) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 3 undervoltage trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid voltage must stay below the stage 3 undervoltage limit (register 60) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 3 overvoltage trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid voltage must stay above the stage 3 overvoltage limit (register 61) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 3 underfrequency trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid frequency must stay below the stage 3 underfrequency limit (register 62) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Stage 3 overfrequency trip delay
holding.description: Cycles grid frequency must stay above the stage 3 overfrequency limit (register 63) before tripping. One AC cycle is 20 ms at 50 Hz (16.7 ms at 60 Hz).

holding.name: Ten-minute overvoltage limit
holding.description: Maximum RMS grid voltage averaged over 10 minutes (0.1 V increments) before the inverter trips.

holding.name: PV input high-voltage fault
holding.description: PV array voltage threshold that triggers a DC over-voltage fault (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: Controller firmware build string
holding.description: Twelve ASCII characters summarising model and controller build revisions (model letters, DSP1, DSP2/M0, CPLD/AFCI, M3).
holding.note: Positions: 0-1 model letters, 2-3 model variant, 4-5 DSP1 build, 6-7 DSP2/M0 build, 8-9 CPLD/AFCI build, 10-11 M3 build.

holding.name: Modbus Version
holding.description: Modbus register map revision encoded as an integer (e.g. 207 equals version 2.07).

holding.name: Power-factor control mode
holding.description: Selects the reactive power or power-factor control curve.
holding.note: 0=Unity PF, 1=Fixed PF setpoint, 2=Default PF line, 3=User-defined PF line, 4=Under-excited reactive power, 5=Over-excited reactive power, 6=Q(V) curve, 7=Direct control, 8=Static capacitive QV, 9=Static inductive QV.

holding.name: GPRS modem IP/status flags
holding.description: Lower nibble reports the IP configuration handshake; upper nibble reports modem status.
holding.note: Bit 0-3: 0=idle, 1=IP read requested, 2=set IP succeeded; Bit 4-7: 0=unknown, 1=modem OK, 2=no SIM, 3=no network, 4=TCP connect fail, 5=TCP connected, etc.

holding.name: Frequency derating start
holding.description: Grid frequency at which active power derating begins (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: Frequency derating slope
holding.description: Slope of the frequency-based active power derating curve. Divide by 10 to obtain percent per hertz.

holding.name: CEI 0-21 Q(V) point V1S
holding.description: Upper voltage limit V1S for the CEI 0-21 Q(V) curve (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: CEI 0-21 Q(V) point V2S
holding.description: Upper voltage limit V2S for the CEI 0-21 Q(V) curve (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: CEI 0-21 Q(V) point V1L
holding.description: Lower voltage limit V1L for the CEI 0-21 Q(V) curve (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: CEI 0-21 Q(V) point V2L
holding.description: Lower voltage limit V2L for the CEI 0-21 Q(V) curve (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: Q(V) lock-in active power
holding.description: Active power percentage (0-100%) that enables CEI 0-21 Q(V) operation.

holding.name: Q(V) lock-out active power
holding.description: Active power percentage (0-100%) below which CEI 0-21 Q(V) control is disabled.

holding.name: Power-factor curve lock-in voltage
holding.description: Voltage threshold (0.1 V increments) for entering the CEI 0-21 power-factor curve.

holding.name: Power-factor curve lock-out voltage
holding.description: Voltage threshold (0.1 V increments) for leaving the CEI 0-21 power-factor curve.

holding.name: Power-factor adjust value 1
holding.description: Fixed-point gain (1/4096 increments) applied when constructing the user-defined PF curve.

holding.name: Power-factor adjust value 2
holding.description: Fixed-point gain (1/4096 increments) applied when constructing the user-defined PF curve.

holding.name: Power-factor adjust value 3
holding.description: Fixed-point gain (1/4096 increments) applied when constructing the user-defined PF curve.

holding.name: Power-factor adjust value 4
holding.description: Fixed-point gain (1/4096 increments) applied when constructing the user-defined PF curve.

holding.name: Power-factor adjust value 5
holding.description: Fixed-point gain (1/4096 increments) applied when constructing the user-defined PF curve.

holding.name: Power-factor adjust value 6
holding.description: Fixed-point gain (1/4096 increments) applied when constructing the user-defined PF curve.

holding.name: Q(V) response delay
holding.description: Delay before applying the Q(V) reactive power response, expressed in whole seconds.

holding.name: Over-frequency derating delay
holding.description: Delay before reducing power once frequency exceeds the derating start, in 50 ms increments.

holding.name: Maximum reactive power magnitude
holding.description: Upper bound for reactive power commands when using the Q(V) curve, stored in 0.1% increments of rated power.

holding.name: PF curve point 1 load
holding.description: Active power percentage for this PF curve waypoint. 255 disables the point.

holding.name: PF curve point 1 target
holding.description: Power-factor target for this PF curve waypoint (value / 10,000). Values below 1 are capacitive (leading).

holding.name: PF curve point 2 load
holding.description: Active power percentage for this PF curve waypoint. 255 disables the point.

holding.name: PF curve point 2 target
holding.description: Power-factor target for this PF curve waypoint (value / 10,000). Values below 1 are capacitive (leading).

holding.name: PF curve point 3 load
holding.description: Active power percentage for this PF curve waypoint. 255 disables the point.

holding.name: PF curve point 3 target
holding.description: Power-factor target for this PF curve waypoint (value / 10,000). Values below 1 are capacitive (leading).

holding.name: PF curve point 4 load
holding.description: Active power percentage for this PF curve waypoint. 255 disables the point.

holding.name: PF curve point 4 target
holding.description: Power-factor target for this PF curve waypoint (value / 10,000). Values below 1 are capacitive (leading).

holding.name: Marketing module string
holding.description: Eight ASCII characters that form the marketing SKU (segments for M, P, U, T, D, B, S codes).
holding.note: Matches the printed module string pattern (e.g. SxxBxx, DxxTxx, PxxUxx, Mxxxx Power) used on data labels.

holding.name: Export limit enable mode
holding.description: Selects the export limiting method: disabled, RS-485 meter, RS-232 meter, or CT clamp.
holding.note: 0=Disabled, 1=RS-485 meter, 2=RS-232 meter, 3=External CT.

holding.name: Export limit power setpoint
holding.description: Active power limit applied by the export control subsystem, stored in 0.1% of rated power (negative values allow controlled export).

holding.name: Tracker coupling mode
holding.description: Defines how the PV trackers are electrically coupled: 0=Independent, 1=DC source sharing, 2=Parallel.

holding.name: Inverter type identifier
holding.description: Sixteen-character ASCII string identifying the inverter hardware variant (register 125 high word, 132 low word).
holding.note: Reserved for factory diagnostics; not currently surfaced by the Home Assistant integration.

holding.name: Bootloader identifier string
holding.description: Eight ASCII characters recorded by the bootloader package. The words are ordered high to low across registers 133-136.
holding.note: Usually reserved; populated only on development or service firmware builds.

holding.name: Reactive power direct-control setpoint
holding.description: Signed 32-bit reactive power request used when the inverter operates in direct control mode (register 89 = 7). Values are stored in 0.1 var increments.
holding.note: Positive values command inductive (lagging) vars; negative values request capacitive (leading) vars.

holding.name: Reactive priority enable
holding.description: Enable (1) to prioritise reactive power commands ahead of active power limits when they conflict. Disable (0) to favour active power output.

holding.name: Reactive priority ratio
holding.description: Dimensionless scaling factor applied when reactive priority is enabled. Divide the register value by 10 to obtain the active-to-reactive trade-off ratio.
holding.note: Tune together with the direct-control setpoint to limit how much active power is sacrificed for reactive support.

holding.name: Night reactive support (SVG)
holding.description: Allows the inverter to remain energised overnight to provide reactive (static var generator) support. Set to 1 to enable, 0 to disable.
holding.note: Enabling consumes a small amount of standby power and should only be used when mandated by the grid operator.

holding.name: Frequency-watt boost start
holding.description: Grid frequency (in 0.01 Hz increments) below which the inverter begins boosting active power according to the frequency-watt curve.
holding.note: Pair with registers 151, 175, and 176 to set the under-frequency support profile.

holding.name: Over-frequency recovery point
holding.description: Frequency threshold (0.01 Hz increments) at which active power recovers to nominal after an over-frequency derate event.
holding.note: Works with registers 154-155 and the recovery delay in register 144.

holding.name: Over-frequency recovery delay
holding.description: Time to wait, in 50 ms increments, before restoring power once the frequency has dropped back below the recovery point (register 143).

holding.name: Zero-current detection enable
holding.description: Enable the anti-islanding zero-current detection routine (1) or leave it disabled (0).
holding.note: Disable only when local interconnection rules explicitly forbid the zero-current method.

holding.name: Zero-current low voltage
holding.description: Lower grid voltage limit for zero-current detection, stored in 0.1 V increments.

holding.name: Zero-current high voltage
holding.description: Upper grid voltage limit for zero-current detection, stored in 0.1 V increments.

holding.name: High-voltage derate start
holding.description: Grid voltage at which active power begins to derate because of over-voltage, stored in 0.1 V increments.

holding.name: High-voltage derate end
holding.description: Grid voltage at which the high-voltage derating curve reaches its minimum active power output.
holding.note: Configure together with register 148 to define the slope of the derating curve.

holding.name: Q(V) stabilisation time
holding.description: Settling time applied when the inverter follows the Q(V) curve, in 0.1 s increments.

holding.name: Frequency-watt boost stop
holding.description: Upper frequency (0.01 Hz increments) where the under-frequency boost tapers back to nominal power.
holding.note: Defines the end point of the frequency-watt boost region together with register 142.

holding.name: CEI under-frequency ramp start
holding.description: Start frequency for the CEI 0-21 under-frequency active power ramp (0.01 Hz increments).
holding.note: Applies when the CEI 0-21 grid profile is selected.

holding.name: CEI under-frequency ramp end
holding.description: End frequency for the CEI 0-21 under-frequency ramp (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: CEI over-frequency ramp start
holding.description: Start frequency for the CEI 0-21 over-frequency derating ramp (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: CEI over-frequency ramp end
holding.description: End frequency for the CEI 0-21 over-frequency ramp (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: CEI undervoltage ramp start
holding.description: Start voltage for CEI 0-21 undervoltage load-shedding, stored in 0.1 V increments.

holding.name: CEI undervoltage ramp end
holding.description: End voltage for CEI 0-21 undervoltage load-shedding (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: CEI overvoltage ramp start
holding.description: Start voltage for CEI 0-21 overvoltage load reduction (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: CEI overvoltage ramp end
holding.description: End voltage for CEI 0-21 overvoltage load reduction (0.1 V increments).

holding.name: Nominal grid voltage selection
holding.description: Selects the nominal grid voltage preset used by the UL ride-through tables.
holding.note: Mappings follow the UL parameter tables (e.g. 0=240 V split-phase, 1=208 V three-phase, 2=480 V three-phase, 3=reserved).

holding.name: Grid watt restoration delay
holding.description: Delay before resuming active power export after a grid event, expressed in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: Reconnect ramp slope
holding.description: Slope of the active power ramp applied when reconnecting to the grid (value / 10 gives percent per second).

holding.name: LFRT stage 1 frequency
holding.description: Low-frequency ride-through stage 1 trigger, stored in 0.01 Hz increments (UL profile).

holding.name: LFRT stage 1 duration
holding.description: Ride-through time for LFRT stage 1, recorded in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: LFRT stage 2 frequency
holding.description: Low-frequency ride-through stage 2 trigger (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: LFRT stage 2 duration
holding.description: Ride-through time for LFRT stage 2, recorded in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: HFRT stage 1 frequency
holding.description: High-frequency ride-through stage 1 trigger (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: HFRT stage 1 duration
holding.description: Ride-through time for HFRT stage 1, recorded in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: HFRT stage 2 frequency
holding.description: High-frequency ride-through stage 2 trigger (0.01 Hz increments).

holding.name: HFRT stage 2 duration
holding.description: Ride-through time for HFRT stage 2, recorded in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: HVRT stage 1 voltage
holding.description: High-voltage ride-through stage 1 trigger expressed in per-unit (value / 1000).

holding.name: HVRT stage 1 duration
holding.description: Ride-through time for HVRT stage 1, recorded in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: HVRT stage 2 voltage
holding.description: High-voltage ride-through stage 2 trigger in per-unit (value / 1000).

holding.name: HVRT stage 2 duration
holding.description: Ride-through time for HVRT stage 2, recorded in 20 ms increments.

holding.name: Under-frequency boost delay
holding.description: Delay applied before increasing power during an under-frequency event, in 50 ms increments.

holding.name: Under-frequency boost rate
holding.description: Slope of the frequency-watt boost curve. Vendor documentation does not specify the unit; values are proportional to percent power per hertz.
holding.note: Empirically values around 50 correspond to approximately 5% per hertz, but confirm on-site before changing.

holding.name: Grid restart high-frequency limit
holding.description: Frequency threshold (0.01 Hz increments) above which reconnect is inhibited after a trip.

holding.name: Over-frequency derate response time
holding.description: Time constant controlling how quickly the inverter reduces power during an over-frequency event (0-500 steps).
holding.note: Growatt documentation implies steps of roughly 0.1 s; confirm on-site before changing.

holding.name: Under-frequency boost response time
holding.description: Time constant controlling how quickly the inverter increases power during an under-frequency event (0-500 steps).
holding.note: Steps are vendor-defined; treat as a tuning knob for the frequency-watt boost ramp rate.

holding.name: Meter link status
holding.description: Indicates whether an external energy meter is detected on the communication bus (0=not detected, 1=detected).

holding.name: Optimizer count
holding.description: Number of optimisers currently paired with the inverter (0-64).
holding.note: Used with Growatt smart optimiser strings.

holding.name: Optimizer configuration flag
holding.description: Reports whether optimiser configuration has completed successfully (0=not configured, 1=complete).

holding.name: PV string scan mode
holding.description: Number of PV strings supported by the connected optimiser system (0=not supported, 8/16/32 = string count).

holding.name: BDC parallel count
holding.description: Number of battery DC converters (BDC) linked in parallel with the inverter.

holding.name: Battery pack count
holding.description: Total number of battery packs discovered across all connected BDCs.

holding.name: Reserved
holding.description: Reserved by the protocol for future use.
holding.note: No documented function.

holding.name: VPP function enable status
holding.description: Indicates whether the virtual power plant (VPP) interface is active (1) or disabled (0).

holding.name: Datalogger server status
holding.description: State of the data logger connection to the remote server (0=connection succeeded, 1=connection failed).

holding.name: PID control reserved
holding.description: Placeholder register reserved for future PID mitigation features.
holding.note: No documented behaviour in protocol v1.24.

holding.name: PID operating mode
holding.description: Selects how the PID (potential induced degradation) mitigation circuit runs.
holding.note: 0=Automatic on demand, 1=Continuous, 2=All-night forced run.

holding.name: PID breaker control
holding.description: Engage (0) or disengage (1) the PID mitigation hardware.
holding.note: Leave enabled unless servicing the PID circuit.

holding.name: PID output voltage setpoint
holding.description: Target voltage for the PID mitigation supply in volts.

holding.name: Alternate serial number
holding.description: Extended 30-character serial number buffer stored as ASCII across registers 209-223.
holding.note: Used by newer dataloggers; apply via commissioning tools when required.

holding.name: Energy calibration factor
holding.description: Incremental calibration coefficient for the cumulative energy counters (0.1% increments).
holding.note: Adjust only during factory calibration; value / 10 applies as a percent multiplier.

holding.name: Anti-islanding override
holding.description: Disables anti-islanding protection when set to 1. Intended solely for laboratory diagnostics.
holding.note: Never disable anti-islanding on a grid-connected installation unless explicitly authorised.

holding.name: Fan self-test trigger
holding.description: Write 1 to start the inverter cooling-fan diagnostic cycle.
holding.note: The inverter clears the flag automatically once the test completes.

holding.name: Neutral line monitoring enable
holding.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) neutral-line monitoring for split-phase grids.

holding.name: Hardware warning flags
holding.description: Bitfield reporting hardware self-check issues (GFCI, SPS, EEPROM warnings).

holding.name: Hardware warning flags (reserved word)
holding.description: Reserved second word for hardware diagnostics; values currently undocumented.
holding.note: Monitor for future firmware updates.

holding.name: Neutral-to-ground detection
holding.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) detection of unintended neutral-to-ground connections.
holding.note: Should remain enabled for safety compliance.

holding.name: Non-standard voltage range
holding.description: Selects alternative grid voltage windows for special approvals.
holding.note: 0=Standard range, 1=Voltage grade 1, 2=Voltage grade 2.

holding.name: Appointed spec override
holding.description: Enable (1) to apply a pre-programmed regional specification override.
holding.note: Use only when instructed by Growatt support.

holding.name: Fast MPPT mode
holding.description: Reserved selector for alternate MPPT tracking speeds.
holding.note: Documented as reserved; leave at 0 unless provided specific guidance.

holding.name: Reserved
holding.description: Reserved register with no documented function.

holding.name: 22~1124 BatSerialNO. Produ
holding.description: / ct serial number of /
holding.note: reserve

holding.name: Commissioning step index
holding.description: Internal step counter used during factory self-check sequences. Installers should leave this value unchanged.

holding.name: Installer longitude word
holding.description: Longitude component recorded for remote diagnostics. Scaling is vendor-defined and not interpreted by Home Assistant.
holding.note: High byte stores coarse longitude degrees; low byte stores vendor-specific minutes granularity.

holding.name: Installer latitude word
holding.description: Latitude component recorded for remote diagnostics. Scaling is vendor-defined and not interpreted by Home Assistant.
holding.note: High byte stores coarse latitude degrees; low byte stores vendor-specific minutes granularity.

holding.name: Reserved diagnostic word
holding.description: Reserved register used during factory diagnostics.

holding.name: Anti-backflow failure threshold
holding.description: Fallback export limit applied when the external limiter fails (0.1% increments of rated power).

holding.name: Reactive loading speed
holding.description: Ramp rate for reactive power adjustments (percent of rated vars per step).
holding.note: 0 disables the ramp and applies changes immediately.

holding.name: Parallel anti-backflow enable
holding.description: Enable coordinated anti-backflow control when multiple inverters operate in parallel.

holding.name: Anti-backflow failure response time
holding.description: Delay in seconds before applying the fallback export limit once limiter communication is lost.

holding.name: Parallel anti-backflow power limit
holding.description: Cluster-wide export limit applied when anti-backflow is active (0.1% increments).

holding.name: Insulation check command
holding.description: Write 1 to trigger a PV insulation (ISO) self-test. The inverter resets the value when the test completes.

holding.name: GPRS module status
holding.description: Status code reported by the integrated GPRS datalogger module.
holding.note: 0=Idle, 1=Module fault, 2=No SIM, 3=No network, 4=TCP connecting, 5=TCP connected.

holding.name: Q(V) inductive limit
holding.description: Maximum inductive (lagging) reactive power allowed by the Q(V) curve (0.1% increments).

holding.name: Q(V) capacitive limit
holding.description: Maximum capacitive (leading) reactive power allowed by the Q(V) curve (0.1% increments).

holding.name: Reactive power adjust failure delay
holding.description: Seconds to wait before retrying a reactive power adjustment after a failure.

holding.name: Super anti-backflow enable
holding.description: Enable the extended anti-backflow algorithm used in certain jurisdictions.
holding.note: 0:disable,1:enable

holding.name: Reactive power settling time
holding.description: Settling time applied after reactive power changes (seconds).

holding.name: QP curve settling time
holding.description: Settling time for the user power-factor (QP) curve adjustments (seconds).

holding.name: Per-unit derate settling time
holding.description: Settling time used when derating power in per-unit control modes (seconds).

holding.name: Q(V) Q2 reactive target
holding.description: Reactive power percentage at the Q2 voltage breakpoint for the Q(V) curve (0.1% increments).
holding.note: Capacitive30% (The corresponding setting is700); Inductive30% (The corresponding setting is 1300); usedforIEE1547

holding.name: Q(V) Q3 reactive target
holding.description: Reactive power percentage at the Q3 voltage breakpoint for the Q(V) curve (0.1% increments).

holding.name: Vref mode enable
holding.description: Lock Q(V) curve voltages to the Vref profile (IEEE 1547 mode).
holding.range: 0: Vref mode for QV curve is not active 1: Vref mode for QV curve isactive
holding.note: When the Vref mode is not activated, the V1~V4 and Q1~Q4uppercomputerofthe QVcurvecanbeadjusted; When Vref mode is activated, V1~V4 of the QV curve are determined with Vref and cannot be changed, and Q1~Q4 can be modified by thehostcomputer .usedforIEE1547

holding.name: Vref filter time
holding.description: Filter time applied to the Vref signal when Vref mode is active (seconds).
holding.note: Activate Vref mode, the output filter value is equal to Vrefwithinthesettime .usedforIEE1547

holding.description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the dry-contact output.

holding.description: Dry contact opens when output power falls below this percentage of rated power.

holding.description: Voltage above which discharge may resume (0.01 V resolution).
